# paleoData_units

The units of a measured or inferred variable at the column level.


---



### [Am2/yr](#Am2_yr){#Am2_yr}


#### Definition
the remanent magnetization that is acquired without the aid of changes in temperature, generally from the application and subsequent removal of an applied direct current field (Credit: Encyclopedia of Geomagnetism and Paleomagnetism).


*source: PaST*


#### Known synonyms



#### NOAA PaST Thesaurus term
[<font size="4">isothermal remanent magnetization</font>](https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=1085) (https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=1085)


---



### [atomic ratio](#atomic_ratio){#atomic_ratio}


#### Definition
a dimensionless unit that is the ratio of atoms of one kind to atoms of another kind.


*source: PaST*


#### Known synonyms
Atomic ratio


#### NOAA PaST Thesaurus term
[<font size="4">atomic ratio</font>](https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=5701) (https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=5701)


---



### [cgs](#cgs){#cgs}


#### Definition
a dimensionless measure of volume magnetic susceptibility that results from values of magnetization and magnetic field strength in centimeter-gram-second units, i.e., electromagnetic units. The dimensionless cgs value of volume magnetic susceptibility can be multiplied by 4*pi to generate the dimensionless SI value.


*source: PaST*


#### Known synonyms



#### NOAA PaST Thesaurus term
[<font size="4">dimensionless (CGS system)</font>](https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=631) (https://www.ncei.noaa.gov/access/paleo-search/cvterms?termId=631)


---

### [degC](#degC){#degC}


#### Definition
a temperature unit which is equal to one kelvin degree. However, they have their zeros at different points. The centigrade scale has its zero at 273.15 K (Credit: Units of measurement ontology).


*source: PaST*


#### Known synonyms
GDD5, ((( null ))) deg C /// degC, degrees, ÂºC, Deg, GDD, kelvin


#### NOAA PaST Thesaurus term

---

### [practical salinity unit](#practical_salinity_unit){#practical_salinity_unit}


#### Definition
a relative unit for the salinity of water that is defined in terms of the ratio of the electrical conductivity of a water sample at 15 degrees Celsius and the pressure of one standard atmosphere, to that of a solution of 32.4356 grams of potassium chloride (KCl) in 1 kilogram of water at the same temperature and pressure. By definition, a ratio that is exactly equal to one corresponds to a practical salinity of 35.


*source: PaST*


#### Known synonyms
psu
